title: Intelligent Instruments: Understanding 21st-Century AI Through Creative Music Technologies
descriptions:
The grant proposal, "Intelligent Instruments: Understanding 21st-Century AI Through Creative Music Technologies," aims to delve into the intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and musical creativity. The project seeks to explore how creative AI impacts our conceptions of art, culture, and society, as well as how it influences human interactions with technology and others. Through the development of instruments with creative AI, the project will investigate human-AI collaboration in music and utilize sonic instruments as scientific tools.

The interdisciplinary approach of the project, which involves diverse scientific disciplines, will be guided by a research collaboration protocol. The principal investigator (PI), with expertise in music, philosophy, and computer science/AI, will provide academic leadership in the project's technology development and humanities-focused activities. 

Ultimately, the project aims to achieve several key outcomes, including a better understanding of the role of creative AI in embodied technologies and a reflection on how artificial intelligence will shape future society. By initiating public discourse on creative AI and developing a theoretical framework for transformed notions of self, others, and knowledge, the project will contribute to defining principles of ethical AI design in services and products. Through music as a platform, the project will lay the groundwork for a broader public understanding of AI and its implications.

The grant proposal titled "Intelligent Instruments: Understanding 21st-Century AI Through Creative Music Technologies" aims to delve into the intersection of Artificial Intelligence and musical creativity. The project's primary focus is on exploring how creative AI is reshaping our conceptions of art, culture, and society, as well as analyzing the impact of AI-generated music on human relationships with technology and others.

Through a series of work packages that involve developing instruments with creative AI, investigating human-AI collaboration in music, and utilizing sonic instruments as scientific tools, the project seeks to initiate public discourse on creative AI and establish a theoretical framework for the evolving notions of self, others, and knowledge in the age of AI.

Led by a Principal Investigator with expertise in Music, Philosophy, and Computer Science/AI, the interdisciplinary project will employ a research collaboration protocol involving diverse scientific disciplines to achieve its goals. The anticipated outcomes include a deeper understanding of the role of creative AI in embodied technologies and reflections on the implications of artificial intelligence in future society.

The project's nature encompasses both technology development and humanities research, with the ultimate benefits being the development of a theoretical framework for creative AI, the initiation of discourse on human-centered AI, and the establishment of principles for ethical AI design. Through using music as a platform, this project aims to foster public understanding of AI and its implications in society.
